The agency also recommends that pets be kept indoors and away from other animals and people outside the household. While the risk of transmission from animals to humans is low, the CDC warns that it is still possible and that precautions should be taken to protect both pets and their owners. The agency is continuing to monitor the situation and provide updates as new information becomes available.

The situation is so dire that the Chinese government has declared a state of emergency and is working with the World Health Organization (WHO) to contain the outbreak. This is because masks can help to filter out the virus from the air, reducing the risk of airborne transmission. The discovery that the COVID-19 virus is airborne is a major breakthrough in the fight against the pandemic. However, it also means that people need to be more vigilant than ever, and take every precaution to prevent the spread of the virus.
